value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-anon" key="Anon">Anon</rs> had sung his song at the back door in a jargon that was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">as uncouth and fxmxmxnxmxmxmxmxmus to <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-whar" key="Harrison, William">Harrison</rs></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">as to ourselves; <del hand="ms">and more barbarous</del></l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="block">
            <l>Icham for wowing al forwake,</l>
            <l>Wery no water in wore</l>
            <l>An hendy hap ichable yghent;</l>
            <l>Ichot from heven it is me sent</l>
          </quote>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the words were as difficult for him to spell out as for us;</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and <add hand="ms" place="above">more</add> for him <add hand="typewriter" place="above">painful;</add> they were <add hand="ms" place="above">[illeg.]</add> reminders of a savagery of low 
            <choice>
              <sic>b rth</sic>
              <corr>birth</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">xmxmxmxmxmxmxx tokens of base birth, of a close <del hand="ms">savage</del> past.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">In the background, mxmxmxmxxx of

              <corr>Harrison's</corr>
            </choice></rs> mind stood</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-suet" key="Suetonius">Suetonius</rs>; <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-plin" key="Pliny">Pliny</rs>, <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-cice" key="Cicero">Cicero</rs>. <del hand="ms">Those were</del> the

            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">occupy in our minds. The readers of his time read the</l>
